dkeep.logic

Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Person
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Club, Guard, Hero, Ogre

    public class Person
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Person(Coordinates coord, char symbol, char key_symbol)
      Constructs an Person given its coordinates, its symbol on the map and its symbol when above the key

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean check_near(Hero person)
      Checks if the player has lost, meaning if the hero is on one of the adjacent squares (except diagonals) to the person (guard, ogre or club)

      Obtains current coordinates of a Person
      char get_key_symbol()
      Obtains symbol drawn in the map when the character has the same coordinates of the key

      Obtains corresponding symbol of the desired Person

              char symbol,
              char key_symbol)
        Constructs an Person given its coordinates, its symbol on the map and its symbol when above the key
        Parameters:
        coord - Coordinate of Person
        symbol - The symbol of the character on the map
        key_symbol - Character when above the key

        public char get_key_symbol()
        Obtains symbol drawn in the map when the character has the same coordinates of the key

      • set_symbol

        Changes the symbol of the character
        Parameters:

      • set_pos

        public void set_pos(Coordinates new_coord)
        Changes the position of the character by changing the its coordinates
        Parameters:

      • move_person

        public void move_person(char key,
                        Map map)
        Moves the character by changing the character's coordinates
        Parameters:
        key - a, 1 to left; d, 1 to the right; w, 1 upwards; s, 1 downwards
        map - Map where the character is stored

      • check_near

        public boolean check_near(Hero person)
        Checks if the player has lost, meaning if the hero is on one of the adjacent squares (except diagonals) to the person (guard, ogre or club)
        Parameters:
        person - Character that makes the player lose - club, ogre or guard depending on the level
        Returns:
        true, if the player is near the person; false, otherwise
